body_html:
@xiejw thanks for catching the bug out. I have committed a fix to make the tests pass. I have confirmed that tests pass on my end by rebasing on upstream.

Your concern on performance is something I agree with however...

If I understand right.. this issue occurs when wrapping around datasets to return to index 0. Perhaps it's better to split the indexing operations to allow for this.

Or dismiss this PR as it could be argued that it's a bug in h5py.

I leave the decision to you, the maintainers.
body_text:
@xiejw thanks for catching the bug out. I have committed a fix to make the tests pass. I have confirmed that tests pass on my end by rebasing on upstream.
Your concern on performance is something I agree with however...
If I understand right.. this issue occurs when wrapping around datasets to return to index 0. Perhaps it's better to split the indexing operations to allow for this.
Or dismiss this PR as it could be argued that it's a bug in h5py.
I leave the decision to you, the maintainers.
body:
@xiejw thanks for catching the bug out. I have committed a fix to make the tests pass. I have confirmed that tests pass on my end by rebasing on upstream.

Your concern on performance is something I agree with however...

If I understand right.. this issue occurs when wrapping around datasets to return to index 0. Perhaps it's better to split the indexing operations to allow for this.

Or dismiss this PR as it could be argued that it's a bug in `h5py`.

I leave the decision to you, the maintainers.
